document_data.caption: A map showing the location of the Tumen River.
document_data.name: Tumen River
document_data.mainbody: The '''Tumen River''' was a river in the kingdom of [[Koryo]] in [[Kara-Tur]].<ref group="note">Like many sites in Koryo, the Tumen River shares a name with a real-world counterpart: the [[Wikipedia:Tumen River|Tumen River]], which lies on the border between North Korea, Russia, and China.
document_data.Geography: Beginning with two tributaries in the [[Vorkani Mountains]], the Tumen River ran between the mountains and the [[Naktong Moors]], and flowing into the [[Sea of Kozakura]] near [[Konang Pen]]. It formed the border between the Koryoan kingdoms of [[Silla]] in the north and [[Koguryo]] in the south.
document_data.History: In [[1357 DR]], villages along the Tumen River were being attacked and even destroyed by [[giant snake]]s. The villagers grew desperate for aid.
